capability-single-custom-image.title: Display an image file as a map layer

bing-maps-embed.notes: most embeds do not support this. Adding a custom image layer requires more configuration than supported by these tools.

google-maps-embed.notes: most embeds do not support this. Adding a custom image layer requires more configuration than supported by these tools.

mapbox-embed.notes: most embeds do not support this. Adding a custom image layer requires more configuration than supported by these tools.

openstreetmap-embed.notes: most embeds do not support this. Adding a custom image layer requires more configuration than supported by these tools.

capability-custom-map-tiles.title: Display a map using tile data from an author-specified web map service

tomtom-sdk.notes: Although TomTom supports WMS services (where the server can generate a single image file for custom map coordinates), it does not support WMTS or other custom tile sources.

capability-no-js.title: Display a basic map without JavaScript

apple-mapkit-js-api.notes: these tools offer options to serve a static image without JavaScript, typically by joining together tiles when the map author passes in a center and zoom level parameter into a specific URL format. However, this is not the default fallback behavior for the embeds when JavaScript is turned off; adding a fallback image must be implemented as a custom feature.

bing-maps-api.notes: these tools offer options to serve a static image without JavaScript, typically by joining together tiles when the map author passes in a center and zoom level parameter into a specific URL format. However, this is not the default fallback behavior for the embeds when JavaScript is turned off; adding a fallback image must be implemented as a custom feature.

capability-preferred-language.title: Display map content in a users preferred language

capability-marker-points.title: Show pinpoint locations or custom markers on the map

bing-maps-embed.notes: allows for display of a general area but no map markers

openstreetmap-embed.notes: only allows you to show a single marker on embedded maps

capability-vector-features.title: Draw polygons or polylines as stylable, interactive vector graphics (separate from the image tiles)

capability-hyperlinks.title: Support hyperlinks from markers or vector features

capability-attribution.title: Display map data attribution and links

mapbox-embed.notes: attribution is automatically generated, but it is not keyboard accessible.

tomtom-sdk.notes: attribution is automatically generated, but it is not keyboard accessible.

capability-location-latlong.title: Select map view from latitude and longitude point

bing-maps-embed.notes: does not support markers for a single location, but it is possible to display a map centered around a particular latitude and longitude point with no marker.

open-layers-api.notes: A location defined with longitude and latitude must be converted to the map tile coordinate system, but the API provides the conversion function.

capability-location-address.title: Select map view from street address or place name

bing-maps-embed.notes: does not support markers for a single location, but it is possible to display a map centered around a particular street address with no marker.

leaflet-api.notes: the default libraries do not support this but there are a wide variety of geocoding plugins that support this capability.

open-layers-api.notes: the default libraries do not support this but there are a wide variety of geocoding plugins that support this capability.

capability-tile-coordinate-systems.title: Display map tiles defined in various common coordinate systems

apple-mapkit-js-api.notes: these embeds only support the Web Mercator projection.

bing-maps-api.notes: these embeds only support the Web Mercator projection.

bing-maps-embed.notes: these embeds only support the Web Mercator projection.

google-maps-embed.notes: these embeds only support the Web Mercator projection.

mapbox-embed.notes: these embeds only support the Web Mercator projection.

openstreetmap-embed.notes: these embeds only support the Web Mercator projection.

tomtom-sdk.notes: these embeds only support the Web Mercator projection.

capability-reproject-maps.title: Reproject map tile data into a new projection or globe view

capability-export-location.title: Save the location or export to other application

google-maps-embed.notes: a user is able to generate a link to the map that can be shared via a variety of methods, but there is no way to easily send this information to another application.

capability-zoom.title: Zoom the map independently from the rest of the page

mapbox-embed.notes: all of the above is supported, but the buttons do not have any focus styles.

apple-mapkit-js-api.notes: Mouse and touch panning only. Keyboard panning is possible on the google maps web application. Keyboard panning is activated when a specific region of the map is focused.

google-maps-api.notes: Mouse and touch panning only. Keyboard panning is possible on the google maps web application. Keyboard panning is activated when a specific region of the map is focused.

google-maps-embed.notes: Mouse and touch panning only. Keyboard panning is possible on the google maps web application. Keyboard panning is activated when a specific region of the map is focused.

leaflet-api.notes: Mouse, touch, and keyboard panning are supported; no keyboard focus indication.

mapbox-embed.notes: Mouse, touch, and keyboard panning are supported; no keyboard focus indication.

openstreetmap-embed.notes: Mouse, touch, and keyboard panning are supported; no keyboard focus indication.

tomtom-sdk.notes: Mouse, touch, and keyboard panning are supported; no keyboard focus indication.

capability-lazy-load.title: Load additional map tiles when they pan into view

capability-wrap-pan.title: Wrap/duplicate data tiles when panning around the globe

capability-scale-adjust.title: Maintain reasonable scale of labels and lines when zooming

capability-zoom-swap.title: Dynamically load different resolution map tile on zoom

capability-zoom-swap-vectors.title: Hide or show (and maybe dynamically load) vector features and labels on zoom

capability-styled-features.title: Apply custom styling to map markers and vector features

capability-styled-controls.title: Apply custom styling to map controls

capability-custom-controls.title: Toggle whether default controls are displayed

mapbox-embed.notes: you can toggle controls for the HTML slippy map, but not maps created in the more robust Mapbox Studio editor.

capability-create-initialise-and-display.title: Create, initialise, and display a map

apple-mapkit-js-api.notes: Allows straightforward creation of a map with configuration options.

bing-maps-api.notes: Allows straightforward creation of a map with configuration options.

d3-geo-api.notes:
The d3-geo module supports vector data in the form of either GeoJSON or TopoJSON. It renders this data to either an SVG or Canvas element. It requires the developer to implement support for interaction using other d3 modules, such as d3-zoom and d3-transition.

By utilising the d3-tile module, tiled raster data can be combined with vector map data.

google-maps-api.notes: Allows straightforward creation of a map with configuration options.

leaflet-api.notes: Leaflet, OpenLayers, and MapBox require explicit construction of objects defining the map layers and viewport, with sensible defaults for creation of, for example, a map showing OpenStreetMap tiles in a standard World Geodetic System 1984 projection. This provides added flexibility, at the expense of increasing the complexity of code that uses these libraries.

mapbox-gl-api.notes: Leaflet, OpenLayers, and MapBox require explicit construction of objects defining the map layers and viewport, with sensible defaults for creation of, for example, a map showing OpenStreetMap tiles in a standard World Geodetic System 1984 projection. This provides added flexibility, at the expense of increasing the complexity of code that uses these libraries.

open-layers-api.notes: Leaflet, OpenLayers, and MapBox require explicit construction of objects defining the map layers and viewport, with sensible defaults for creation of, for example, a map showing OpenStreetMap tiles in a standard World Geodetic System 1984 projection. This provides added flexibility, at the expense of increasing the complexity of code that uses these libraries.

tomtom-sdk.notes: Allows straightforward creation of a map with configuration options.

capability-add-marker-or-multiple-marker.title: Add a marker or multiple markers to a map

d3-geo-api.notes: By default, d3-geo will render point features as circles. These can be styled using whatever techniques are being used to style the map content, typically either using presentational SVG attributes, or CSS. In practice, adding markers in a manner similar to that offered by other mapping APIs might best be achieved by dynamically creating a GeoJSON feature containing the point features in a FeatureCollection and adding this as an additional layer on the map.

open-layers-api.notes: Rather than providing a straightforward API, OpenLayers requires a number of steps to be followed: providing icon imagery (as there is no default imagery provided), creating icon features, creating a map layer to hold those features, and finally adding the layer to a map. This is noticeably more complex than the APIs provided by a number of other implementations.

bing-maps-api.notes: Bing Maps expects controls to be implemented as a type of overlay. It provides no particular support for controls beyond that, not even for positioning them within the map UI, which is left to the developer to achieve using CSS positioning.

d3-geo-api.notes: Although d3 supports a variety of user interactions, the concept of a user interface presenting a collection of controls to the user is not part of the library.

google-maps-api.notes: While Google Maps supports the adding and removing of controls and the specifying of their placement within a number of predefined areas within the map's UI, there is no specific interface to which they are expected to conform.

leaflet-api.notes: Leaflet, TomTom (which uses Leaflet), and OpenLayers provide base classes which controls extend, along with map methods for adding and removing controls. OpenLayers also exposes its control collection directly.

mapbox-gl-api.notes: MapBoxGL specifies an interface to which controls are expected to conform. The map API provides methods for adding and removing controls to and from the map UI.

open-layers-api.notes: Leaflet, TomTom (which uses Leaflet), and OpenLayers provide base classes which controls extend, along with map methods for adding and removing controls. OpenLayers also exposes its control collection directly.

tomtom-sdk.notes: Leaflet, TomTom (which uses Leaflet), and OpenLayers provide base classes which controls extend, along with map methods for adding and removing controls. OpenLayers also exposes its control collection directly.

capability-add-layer-map.title: Add a layer to a map

capability-define-data-source-tile-layer.title: Define a data source for a tile layer

capability-create-an-overlay-defined-by-.title: Create an overlay defined by vector data
Create an overlay defined by heatmap data

apple-mapkit-js-api.notes: MapKit JS does not support a heatmap overlay at present, and no third-party plugins adding support are known of.

bing-maps-api.notes: Bing Maps has native support for heatmaps via a separate module that must be explicitly loaded in JavaScript, rather than being specified declaratively in HTML.

d3-geo-api.notes: Leaflet (and by extension TomTom) and d3 have third-party plugins available which add support.

leaflet-api.notes: Leaflet (and by extension TomTom) and d3 have third-party plugins available which add support.

tomtom-sdk.notes: Leaflet (and by extension TomTom) and d3 have third-party plugins available which add support.

capability-control-layers-map.title: Control which layers are included in a map

capability-specify-style-map.title: Specify the style of a map

capability-determine-current-style-map.title: Determine the current style of a map

capability-get-bounds-map.title: Get the bounds of a map

capability-pan-zoom-or-re-centre-map.title: Pan, zoom, or re-centre a map

capability-map-events.title: Subscribe to notifications of map events

apple-mapkit-js-api.notes: Although all existing implementations support an events system capable of meeting the needs of developers, inconsistencies in terminology, semantic richness, and the interfaces provided for adding and removing event listeners mean that it is unclear whether any one of the existing APIs would be a suitable model for the various capabilities available across the entire range of them.
